sql.statement: select pa.latest_version_id = p.id as latest_version, p.id as _id, package_name as _parent, package_name, version, title, description, release_date, license, url, copyright, p.created_at, p.updated_at, sourceJSON, m.name as `maintainer.name`, m.email as `maintainer.email`, c.name as `collaborators.name`, c.email as `collaborators.email` from Packages pa INNER JOIN PackageVersions p on pa.`name` = p.`package_name` LEFT OUTER JOIN Collaborators m ON p.maintainer_id = m.id LEFT OUTER JOIN Collaborations ca ON ca.`authored_version_id` = p.id LEFT OUTER JOIN Collaborators c on c.id = ca.author_id WHERE p.updated_at > ? ORDER BY p.id;
